question: 合わせる
sourceAnswer: to{} match-(rhythm,-speed,-etc.) | join-together/unite/combine/add-up | face/be-opposite-(someone) | compare/check-with | cause-to-meet-(e.g.-an-unpleasant-fate) | place-together/connect/overlap | mix/combine | put-blade-to-blade/fight
sourceMnemonic: You know that the alternative kanji meaning for <ja>合</ja> is <kanji>join</kanji>, which is what we're using here. The verb form of join is <vocabulary>to join together</vocabulary>, and it can also mean <vocabulary>to unify</vocabulary> and <vocabulary>to match</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic: The reading comes from <ja>合う</ja>, so if you know that reading you'll know this reading as well.
